decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using Rakdos colors, with a main focus on utilizing the companion card Jegantha, the Wellspring. The deck includes a mix of creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester, Voldaren Epicure, and Flamecache Gecko, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand. The mana base is built around lands like Mutavault, Blood Crypt, and Blackcleave Cliffs to ensure consistent color access for spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a mix of creatures and removal spells.

This deck aims to utilize the Transmogrify combo to cheat out powerful creatures onto the battlefield. Cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Transmogrify are used to exchange lower-cost tokens for high-impact creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Reckoner Bankbuster. The deck also includes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push and Volcanic Spite. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with big threats.

The deck focuses on using ramp and control elements to quickly build up mana and out-value opponents. It utilizes cards like Lotus Cobra and Omnath, Locus of Creation to ramp into powerful spells while controlling the board with cards like Portable Hole and Get Lost. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by flickering key permanents for extra ETB triggers. The deck aims to ramp up quickly, control the game, and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through removal spells like Torch the Tower and Get Lost, while utilizing powerful creatures such as The Wandering Emperor and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to dominate the battlefield. Sunfall and March of Otherworldly Light provide additional control options, while Wedding Announcement and Caretaker's Talent offer card advantage and utility. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control strategy with a mix of lands that provide both colored mana and utility effects like Field of Ruin.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures and ramp creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while benefitting from cards like Righteous Valkyrie and Resplendent Angel. Collected Company is used to bring out multiple creatures at once, maximizing the deck's potential to flood the board and win through overwhelming aggression. The deck also includes support cards like Bishop of Wings and Skyclave Apparition to provide additional utility and protection.

This Spirit Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing low-cost creatures like Mausoleum Wanderer and Shacklegeist to apply early pressure. Cards like Supreme Phantom and Spell Queller help to disrupt opposing strategies while also boosting the power of your Spirits. Collected Company provides additional creature card advantage and board presence, allowing you to quickly close out games. The deck's mana base supports a balance of white, blue, and green mana sources to ensure consistent access to your key cards.

This deck focuses on assembling the Lotus Field combo by using cards like Arboreal Grazer, Sylvan Scrying, and Hidden Strings to generate mana quickly. Once Lotus Field is on the battlefield, the player can use cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Fae of Wishes to search for powerful spells like Omniscience and Dark Petition. The goal is to set up a strong board state and cast powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent and secure a win. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Lair of the Hydra to support the combo strategy.

The deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay with cards that synergize well together to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It utilizes creatures with haste and pump spells to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds versatility to the deck, allowing for additional mana ramp options. The deck is designed to take advantage of the Rakdos color combination to maximize damage output and pressure the opponent to quickly secure a win.
